I can definitely relate to Ems from his kids point of view. My parent were struggling ever since they got married and got me, debts and moving houses is a frequent thing my whole life. They were saving up alot to build me a home, a tuition, everything was literally their blood and tears. I had to move to my grandparents house because mom and dad were handling the debts in the city. They finally can afford for me living with them after 2 year of my dad fighting with depression, he couldnt go to work so mom have to carried him through all of it. The next few years they got a little better with financial problems, but things kept going up and down, they fought alot over it too. And after years and years of struggling, finally they bought a house, at that moment, i think life is way better than it used to be, but then mom got cancer. After two years of battling with cancer, she passed away and a few months right before mom's passing, dad went to jail because of some mixed up, so they never had a chance to see each other the last time, at the time, i was dealing with mental health problems so its hard for me to actually talk to mom and tell her goodbye, still my biggest regret ever. My parent were trying so hard just to make me smile and i have so much respect for them.

Rest in Peace, Momma, you and Dad deserve the world
